job_info.role_description: Work on data preprocessing, cleaning, and transforming raw data into a usable format for modeling; collaborate with senior engineers to optimize machine learning models for performance and scalability; participate in the training and fine-tuning of models to improve accuracy and efficiency; conduct research on emerging AI/ML techniques and contribute to proof-of-concept development; document model development, research, and performance metrics for future reference and learning; collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business problems and provide AI/ML-driven solutions; assist in developing deployment pipelines for ML models, ensuring they are scalable and efficient; assist in the development and implementation of machine learning models for various business applications

soft_skills: Ability to work effectively in a team environment

preferred_skills: Understanding of machine learning concepts and algorithms
Exposure to AI/ML through academic projects, internships, or online courses
job_responsibilities: Work on data preprocessing, cleaning, and transforming raw data into a usable format for modeling
Collaborate with senior engineers to optimize machine learning models for performance and scalability
Participate in the training and fine-tuning of models to improve accuracy and efficiency
Conduct research on emerging AI/ML techniques and contribute to proof-of-concept development
Document model development, research, and performance metrics for future reference and learning
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business problems and provide AI/ML-driven solutions
Assist in developing deployment pipelines for ML models, ensuring they are scalable and efficient
Assist in the development and implementation of machine learning models for various business applications

questions.question: 2. Which TensorFlow 2.x API should you use for quick layer stacking without writing a custom training loop?
3. In PyTorch, the correct way to compute the cross-entropy loss for raw logits and integer targets is:
4. A Git command that undoes the last commit while keeping changes staged is:
5. Which SQL clause is mandatory whenever you use an aggregate function like COUNT() alongside non-aggregated columns?
6. In Keras, which callback automatically stops training if validation loss stops improving for a specified number of epochs?
7. You have a pandas DataFrame `df` with a column `price` that contains outliers. Which scikit-learn transformer is most suitable for scaling this column to a robust range?
8. In PyTorch, to move a model instance `model` to GPU device 0, the correct syntax is:
9. Which TensorFlow module provides off-the-shelf data augmentation layers such as RandomFlip and RandomRotation?
10. In SQL, which join type returns all rows from the left table and matched rows from the right table, filling with NULLs when there is no match?
11. To save a scikit-learn model named `clf` to disk using joblib, the correct line is:
12. In Keras, which optimizer is recommended as a good default starting point for most deep-learning tasks?
13. Which pandas method is best suited to fill missing values with the mean of each column?
14. In PyTorch, the proper way to disable gradient computation for inference is:
15. When you increase the batch size during training, which of the following effects is most likely?

options.text: Training becomes slower per epoch but gradients are more accurate
Training becomes faster per epoch and GPU memory usage decreases
GPU memory usage increases and training becomes faster per epoch
GPU memory usage decreases and gradients become more accurate

questions.question: You have a pandas DataFrame `df` containing 50,000 image labels stored as lowercase strings. Before feeding the labels to a Keras model expecting one-hot encoded targets, which single-line command correctly converts the column to the required format?
